description: Continuation of STAT 101. A thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression; introduction to time series. Business applications.
name: INTRO BUSINESS STAT

values.comments:
Statistics 102, a continuation of Statistics 101, includes a thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression, introduction to time series, and business applications. 
	This class received mixed reviews. Some found the course content “useful” though others claimed not to have learned much in the class. One student commented that everything they learned in the course “has been self-learning and guesswork.” Another student said “the course content was useful, [but] the lectures and problem sets didn’t accurately reflect what was expected to know on tests.” 
	Students’ reviews of Professor Brown were incredibly mixed. While one student described him as, “a great person, funny, and sweet,” most students found him “boring” and “very confusing” and struggled with how Professor Brown conveyed course content. 
	The prerequisite to this class is Statistics 101. The course is a requirement for all Wharton undergraduates, but it is open to all students.

STAT 102 is a continuation of STAT 101. The class includes a thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, and linear logistic regression and an introduction to time series. The course focuses on business applications.

Many students thought that STAT 102 was “very useful” and “relevant.” Students commented that the class was based partially on understanding and producing JMP output, as well as “putting actual numbers to the concepts.” These students enjoyed the “real-world” applications, but an equal number of students commented that the material was “boring.” Several students commented that the best study material for the class was the slide decks. 

Many students commented that while they noticed Professor Zhang had “enthusiasm,” and “knows the material,” they had “trouble understanding the way she presents in class.” One student suggested that this difficulty in understanding may stem from the fact that Professor Zhang is a “first-time lecturer of this course.” Another student said that the difficulty in understanding stemmed from Professor Zhang “only focusing on examples for every class” without teaching the core concepts. Multiple students commented that lecture notes and exams often had typos, and that Professor Zhang would sometimes write down incorrect equations on the board. Nevertheless, a significant portion of students noted that Professor Zhang was “approachable” and “nice.” 

The majority of students commented that a recitation would be helpful for the course because office hours often were not long enough for all students to ask questions. As a result, many students commented that the exams were “difficult,” even though cheat sheets were allowed. Students also commented that most of the quizzes were in the last half of the semester, which made the workload uneven. STAT 102 is required for Wharton students. The prerequisite is STAT 101. This course has a business focus, but is not inappropriate for students in the college.
